pros: Great work environment and employees.
cons: Your self schedule gets moved around a lot.

pros: Nice setup, especially nice patients.

job_title: Interventional Radiology Technologist in Ventura, CA
pros: Day shift, 10 hour shift
cons: Call, pay, elective cases after hours

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) in Paulding, OH
pros: Small town feel. Close to home. Co Workers are like family
cons: Upper management shows little to no appreciation for working many hours over your scheduled time. They just expect you to fill in no matter what.

pros: Great team of people and great experience
cons: Sometimes a lot of patients and hard work

pros: Co-workers encouraging, management was decent
cons: A lot of hard work, not enough staff

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in San Diego, CA
pros: Had some of the best co-workers
cons: There was a lack of management and leadership

job_title: E R Admissions Clerk in Ventura, CA
pros: Decent pay but benefits started going downhill because they were trying save money because they had ho build the new hospital.
cons: Gary Wilde(the CEO)  is out for the almighty dollar. Entire departments were outsourced. Leaving long-term employees jobless. They changed the entire food service to an outside company. Prices went through the roof and portions were tiny. CMH needed to build a new hospital to earth quack codes. They also needed to compete with other hospitals. All I heard in the 4 years I was there was how good the hospital was BEFORE Gary Wilde took over.

review_title: family like atmosphere devoted to the local residents
pros: small enough to get to know most of the other employees, easy to learn the facility layout, good opportunity to dabble in multiple specialty areas of care
cons: small family-like atmosphere also means small town gossip, small facility so high acuity patients transfered to bigger hospitals limiting learning opportunities to lower acuity levels

review_title: CMH is an extremely friendly place to work
job_title: Registered Nurse in Oconto Falls, WI
pros: The teamwork here is very good.  Everyone is friendly and helpful, even when it is extremely busy.  I have never worked with better people!
cons: Because it is in a pretty rural area, the pay is below average, even for this area.  The benefits are not that wonderful either, but if you want a wonderful work environment, this is it!

review_title: They had me thinking I would grow to retire there in 30 years.
pros: Very little to speak well of. If you get in on a good group of co-works it is the best.
cons: They don't keep their promises, Pay is lowest in county, Always shuffle going on in management its hard to keep it straight. When things go bad upstairs they take people down with them. Don't get to "big for your britches" the ones that raised you will knock you down in a heart beat. Favoritism. lies. unfair schedule. PAY SUCKS.

review_title: great location, however you will age as you wait for full time position to open.
pros: location, small hospital, near the beach.
cons: people don't retire and good luck getting a full time position.

pros: I am able to deliver high-quality care due to lower volume of patients.
cons: Low volume of intrapartum care.

pros: Nice Dr's and Nurses, caring about teaching new DR's
cons: Out of date facility.... building new one  slow

pros: Very friendly nurses, and most of the workers
